authors: Shayan Shankar For Daily Mail Australia
description: Footage shot by the Australian Reptile Park shows five turtles gobbling up a juicy watermelon for their afternoon snack while one hungry turtle ignores the proper dining etiquette.
title: Australian Reptile Park turtles munch on melon
title_page: Australian Reptile Park turtles munch on melon | Daily Mail Online
text:
Sharing food can have its share of complications, but one eager turtle wasn't about to let courtesy get in the way of hunger.
Adorable footage shot by the Australian Reptile Park shows five turtles munching on a juicy watermelon for their afternoon snack at the wildlife sanctuary in Somersby.
But not letting table manners get in the way of a good feed, one hungry turtle ignored his fellow diners and crawled his way all over fruit, taking a bite wherever it could.
Scroll down for video
A cheeky turtle ignored his friends while he climbed on top of a watermelon to munch on his fruity snack
While turtles are known for their diets of protein and calcium, the five turtles were clearly enjoying a break from their usual cuisine.
The rogue turtle began its journey through the watermelon peacefully enough but it didn't take long for it to work its way through.
At one point all four of its webbed feet rested entirely upon the watermelon as it snacked away.
The hand of a zookeeper could be seen lifting the turtle back to the watermelon's rind multiple times when the turtle strayed too far.
Meanwhile his dining comrades sat patiently around the edge, utilising proper eating etiquette while doing their best to ignore their keen friend.
One frustrated turtle had to stop its eating while it was being bumped into by the ravenous reptile who cared little for the boundaries the others were observing.
The five turtles began their dining experience relatively normally, before the hungry turtle started to take over
The turtles enjoyed their afternoon snack at the Australian Reptile Park wildlife sanctuary in Somersby
